meanings.definition: A disaccharide sugar consisting of two glucose molecules.
meanings.sent1: Trehaloses are sweet sugars made of two glucose parts.
meanings.sent2: In some foods, you can find trehaloses, which are made of two glucose units.
meanings.sent3: The trehaloses in the candy shop were having a party with the other sugars.
meanings.sent4: The trehaloses in the recipe acted like a dynamic duo of glucose molecules.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, trehaloses look like tiny pairs of glucose buddies.

meanings.definition: A type of sugar found in certain insects and fungi.
meanings.sent1: Certain insects and fungi contain trehaloses as a special sugar.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the trehaloses found in insects and fungi to learn more about them.
meanings.sent3: The fungi threw a party to celebrate the trehaloses they discovered.
meanings.sent4: Insects and fungi rely on trehaloses as their secret energy source.
meanings.sent5: The trehaloses in the forest glowed like magical sugars in the sunlight.
